doc.previous: In the American federalist system citizens are usually subject to three levels of government federal state and local The local government s duties are commonly split between county and municipal governments In almost all cases executive and legislative officials are elected by a plurality vote of citizens by district There is no proportional representation at the federal level and it is very rare at lower levels 255
doc.after: The federal government is composed of three branches
